title: Few showers expected in parts of the island today
byline: The Meteorology Department states that a few spells of showers will occur in Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in Galle, Matara, Kandy, and Nuwara Eliya districts.

title: Magnitude 7.4 earthquake strikes Russia’s Kamchatka, tsunami warning issued
byline: A 7.4-magnitude earthquake struck off the coast of Kamchatka in Russia’s Far East on Saturday, the United States Geological Survey (USGS) said.

title: Accomplice of ‘Backhoe Saman’ arrested with firearm and ammunition
byline: Police have arrested an accomplice of the underworld figure known as ‘Backhoe Saman’ in Gangeyaya, Embilipitiya.

title: Former Wattegama UC Chairman arrested with illegally imported vehicles
byline: Police have arrested the former Chairman of the Wattegama Urban Council, along with one of his close associates, for the possession of two illegally imported jeep vehicles.

title: Deputy Minister clarifies provisions of Gaming Regulatory Authority Act
byline: The Gaming Regulatory Authority Act will provide the necessary powers to establish an authority to regulate gaming activities in Sri Lanka, Deputy Minister of Economic Development Dr. Anil Jayantha Fernando stated.

title: Sri Lanka welcomes UN resolution endorsing New York declaration on Palestine
byline: Sri Lanka has welcomed the adoption by the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA) of the resolution endorsing the New York Declaration on the peaceful settlement of the Question of Palestine and the implementation of the two-state solution.

title: NIA court summons Pakistani official in Sri Lanka over plot to bomb US, Israeli consulates in India – report
byline: The special NIA court in Poonamallee has issued a proclamation, directing a Pakistani official working in the country’s high commission in Sri Lanka to appear before it on October 15, to respond to charges of conspiring to bomb the American consulate in Chennai and Israeli consulate in Bengaluru.

title: Nepal’s Parliament dissolves as new PM sworn-in; polls set for March 2026
byline: Nepal President Ramchandra Paudel on Friday dissolved the House of Representatives at the recommendation of newly appointed interim Prime Minister Sushila Karki, and announced fresh parliamentary elections for March 05, 2026.

title: Army deserter who shot dead 4 persons last month arrested by STF
byline: A former army soldier suspected of being involved in four murders, including the shooting death of a former prison officer in Bandaragama and the recent killing of two youths in Borella, has been arrested by the Police Special Task Force (STF).

title: Solidarity and unity among all religions essential for justice and equality – PM
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya emphasized that solidarity and unity among all religions is essential to building justice and equality in the country.

title: Education Ministry issues official school term calendar for 2026
byline: The Ministry of Education (MoE) has announced the official school term calendar for the year 2026, applicable to all Government and Government-approved private schools.

title: Sri Lanka expresses solidarity with Qatar after Israel’s attack
byline: Sri Lanka’s Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs Arun Hemachandra has held a telephone conversation today with Qatar’s Minister of State for Foreign Affairs, Sultan bin Saad bin Sultan Al Muraikhi.

title: President Dissanayake congratulates Nepal’s Interim PM Sushila Karki
byline: Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Dissanayake on Saturday congratulated Nepal’s interim Prime Minister, Sushila Karki, while expressing confidence that her leadership will guide Nepal towards a return to lasting peace and democracy.

title: Indian arrested with Kush worth Rs. 85 million at BIA
byline: An Indian national has been arrested by officers of the Police Narcotics Bureau (PNB) at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake for attempting to smuggle a large consignment of Kush cannabis.

title: Traffic restrictions on Colombo-Galle main road at Wadduwa
byline: Police have issued a notice regarding traffic restrictions on the Colombo-Galle Main Road in the Wadduwa are due to the annual ‘Sri Dalada Perahera’ of the Daladawatta Purana Maha Viharaya in Thalpitiya, Wadduwa.

title: Circular allowing decorations and accessories on buses cancelled
byline: The Commissioner General of Motor Traffic has stated that the circular issued on 2 June 2023, which permitted decorations and accessories to be fitted to passenger transport buses, has been cancelled with effect from 9 September 2025.

title: Trump says he’s ready to put ‘major sanctions’ on Russia if NATO nations do the same
byline: US President Donald Trump said Saturday he is “ready to do major Sanctions on Russia” once all NATO countries have started “to do the same thing” and pause their purchases of oil from Moscow.

title: Arrest warrant issued for Weligama PS Chairman
byline: The Matara Chief Magistrate’s Court has issued a warrant for the arrest of Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha Chairman Lasantha Wickramasekara.
